executive_summary: The Online Sunglasses Sales industry has experienced significant growth over the five years to 2021. Many factors worked in the industry’s favor over the past five years, with revenue increasing at an annualized rate of 8.7% to $1.6 billion in 2021. Rising income levels between 2016 and 2019, coupled with increasing percentage of services conducted online boosted industry revenue over the majority of the period. In 2020, the onset of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic resulted in significant economic uncertainty, however, industry operators absorbed the majority of demand for industry products as e-commerce sales skyrocketed amid health mandates and store closures. Thus, while overall demand for sunglasses remained relatively steady, industry revenue increased as operators earned sales normally made at brick-and-mortar locations. Although e-commerce sales are expected to subside as consumers resume in-person shopping following vaccine distribution in 2021, industry revenue is forecast to increase 6.8% in 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Strong industry performance has led to increase in industry participation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Strong industry performance has led to an increase in industry participation from new entrants and operators with a previous presence in physical retail.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Average industry profit margin expected to decline
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Resultingly, the average industry profit margin is expected to decline. For more detail, please see the Cost Structure Benchmarks chapter.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry to continue growing at slower pace
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2026, the Online Sunglasses Sales industry is anticipated to continue growing, albeit at a slower pace than over the five years to 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Market saturation and intense competition to limit profit margin growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: However, the market for online sunglasses retailers is anticipated to become more saturated and will be characterized by intense internal and external competition, limiting growth in the average industry profit margin.

industry_definition: This industry sells optical goods, including sunglasses, prescription sunglasses and other related items, via the internet. This includes online-only retailers as well as brick-and-mortar stores that have an online presence.
key_trends: The industry has benefited from an increased preference for online shopping due to growth in per capita disposable income
Technological advancements related to the internet and the proliferation of mobile devices have benefited industry operators
Compared with brick-and-mortar retailers, online operators have several advantages in terms of operating costs
Market saturation and intense price-based competition will likely discourage some new entrants
As consumers begin to regain confidence in the economy, they will also begin to shop for discretionary products
Operators will have to get creative and launch different initiatives to keep customers due to the intense internal and external competition
The industry's strong growth rate coupled with low barriers to entry has resulted in new operators entering the industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 18 to 34 are estimated to account for 42.9% of industry revenue in 2021.
Consumers aged 35 to 54 are estimated to be the second-largest customer market.
Consumers aged 55 and older comprise 18.9% of total revenue for the Online Sunglasses Sales industry.

products_and_services.product_description: Women's sunglasses are anticipated to account for 54.4% of industry revenue in 2021.
Men's sunglasses are focused for sports and outdoor recreational activities.
All other optical goods include prescription sunglasses and related accessories.

tier_1_suppliers: Glasses & Contact Lens Manufacturing in the US
Glasses & Contacts Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for the Online Sunglasses Sales industry depends on consumer spending and preferences.
Branded eyewear has become more acceptable and consumers are willing to spend more.
Increased awareness about UV protection increases demand for polarized sunglasses.
Seasons also play a role in demand for sunglasses.
As consumers turn to e-commerce, demand for industry products will increase.

international_trade_points.trade_description: International trade activity for the Online Sunglasses Sales industry is primarily at the manufacturing level.

business_locations.location_description: The industry is highly concentrated in the West region.
The Southeast and Mid-Atlantic regions are also home to a large concentration of industry establishments.
The Southeast and Mid-Atlantic regions are also home to a large concentration.
The Great Lakes region has a lower share of establishments than population.
The Southwest region has a lower share of establishments than population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Includes guidelines like Sherman Antitrust Act.
Compliance with Fair Labor Standards Act.
Online retailers must collect sales tax if state mandates it.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Low capital requirements due to e-commerce model
barriers_points.barrier_description: Technological advancements allow low-cost e-commerce setups.
New entrants must partner with established brands.

basis_points.basis_title: Internal competition based on price and quality
basis_points.basis_description: Competition among operators focuses on price and brand recognition.
Clear return policies enhance customer loyalty.
Competes with traditional retailers for market share.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 2 players account for only 10.2% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: Merger of major players increased market concentration.
Most operators have fewer than 10 employees.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages account for a significant portion of revenue.
Marketing costs are vital for competition.
Rent is significantly lower in e-commerce.
Utilities costs are minimized due to online operations.
Other expenses include transportation and administrative costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Operators invest in software and web infrastructure.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Physical store competition affects online sales.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Online retailers in this industry sell a variety of different types of sunglasses at a range of price points.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on wealthy consumers or households?
FAQs.answer: While designer sunglasses rely on wealthy consumers, the variety in price points allows operators to rely on a wide range of customers.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: Rising input costs are not substantial enough to greatly affect industry sales.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Larger and well-known operators benefit from working directly with sunglasses manufacturers to reduce purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Operators have benefited from the rise of online sales and consumer comfort with purchasing sunglasses online.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Operators have introduced new technology, allowing for better inventory and customer relationship management.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Changes in e-commerce tax laws have impacted profitability.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with trade organizations to stay updated on regulations.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Average industry profit margins have decreased due to external competition.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Many operators do not offer financing options, resulting in timely payments.

FAQs.question: How important is the role of technology in the industry? Has COVID-19 increased its importance?
FAQs.answer: The role of technology is critical and has increased in importance due to COVID-19.

FAQs.question: Do operators in this industry provide superior after sales service?
FAQs.answer: Superior after sales service is crucial for retaining customers.

FAQs.question: In what ways will your business benefit from increases in consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Increases in consumer spending are closely linked to revenue growth in the industry.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue do you spend on advertising online?
FAQs.answer: Advertising expenditures are necessary to remain competitive.
